data.title: California announces $20M cannabis research grant recipients
data.excerpt: Sixteen grant recipients will study medicinal use of cannabis, cannabis potency, health of the cannabis industry, monopolies and unfair competition, and California legacy genetics & genetic sequencing CALIFORNIA – The California Department of Cannabis Control (DCC) awarded almost $20 million in research grants to 16 academic institutions. These studies will support scientific research on the […]

og_meta.meta_title: California announces $20M cannabis research grant recipients
og_meta.meta_description: The California Department of Cannabis Control (DCC) awarded almost $20 million in research grants to 16 academic institutions. These studies will support scientific research on the impacts of cannabis on the mental health of young people, novel cannabinoids like Delta-8 and Delta-10 THC, and a first-of-its kind study of California’s legacy cannabis genetics, intended to preserve the history, value, and diversity of the communities that steward them.
